description: This source file contains helper routines for configuring and unconfiguring network interfaces, particularly handling VLANs, MAC addresses, IP address network extraction, and interface details such as MAC addresses. It provides functions like get_network, get_mac, incr_mac, convert_v4_2_v6, config_vlan, and unconfig_vlan, which facilitate network interface setup and management.

methods.name: get_network
methods.description: Extracts the network portion of an IP address assuming a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0.

methods.name: get_mac
methods.description: Retrieves the MAC address of a specified network interface.

methods.name: incr_mac
methods.description: Increments a given MAC address by a specified amount.

methods.name: convert_v4_2_v6
methods.description: Converts an IPv4 address into its IPv6 4-octet (hexadecimal) representation.

methods.name: config_vlan
methods.description: Configures a physical interface to be part of a VLAN with specified VLAN ID, setting up VLAN tagging.

methods.name: unconfig_vlan
methods.description: Removes VLAN configuration from a specified VLAN ID.
